main event: An unidentified object was observed moving at an estimated speed of 3,000 miles per hour in a northwesterly direction near Point Conception, California on 24 March 1952.
interesting points: The object was detected on radar with a positive speed calculation of 2,700 knots while flying at an altitude of 23,000 feet., The navigator and radar operator, both experienced in combat missions, were confirmed witnesses., The sighting lasted approximately 1-2 minutes., No weather anomalies were present that could explain the radar readings., The object was described visually as a rapidly moving light.
witness description: navigator and radar operator both experienced in military combat missions
